title: Watch error on Webpack 5.55.0+
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template because we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->

# Bug report

<!-- Please ask questions on StackOverflow or the webpack Gitter. -->
<!-- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=webpack -->
<!-- https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack -->
<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->

**What is the current behavior?**

I used in my project Webpack, Mini-CSS-Extract-plugin and Font-awesome library. There are no problems on Webpack versions prior to 5.55.0. After updating Webpack from 5.54.0 to version 5.55.0 (and above) i get compile error on every file update in watch mode.

```
./css/styles.scss 39 bytes [built] [1 error]

ERROR in ./css/styles.scss
Module build failed (from ../node_modules/mini-css-extract-plugin/dist/loader.js):
Error: waitFor can only be called for an already started item
    at AsyncQueue.waitFor (D:\14\frontend\node_modules\webpack\lib\util\AsyncQueue.js:180:5)
    at D:\14\frontend\node_modules\webpack\lib\Compilation.js:4690:25
    at processQueue (D:\14\frontend\node_modules\webpack\lib\util\processAsyncTree.js:50:4)
    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:78:11)

```

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**

1. Setup a project what uses: Webpack 5.55.0+, Mini-CSS-Extract-plugin, Font-awesome
2. Run this project in Watch mode
3. Make a change in every source CSS-file in Watch mode.


<!-- A great way to do this is to provide your configuration via a GitHub repository -->
<!-- The most helpful is a minimal reproduction with instructions on how to reproduce -->
<!-- Repositories with too many files or large `webpack.config.js` files are not suitable -->
<!-- Please only add small code snippets directly into this issue -->
<!-- https://gist.github.com is a good place for longer code snippets -->
<!-- If your issue is caused by a plugin or loader, please create an issue on the loader/plugin repository instead -->

I made a simple project to reproduce this behavior:
[Simple project to reproduce this bug](http://sybernas.myqnapcloud.com:8080/share.cgi?ssid=0nAhchK)

**What is the expected behavior?**

The recompile process is working withou any problems on Webpack versions prior 5.55.0


<!-- "It should work" is not a helpful explanation -->
<!-- Explain exactly how it should behave -->

**Other relevant information:**
webpack version:  5.58.2
Node.js version:  16.10.0
Operating System: Windows 10 21H1
Additional tools:
